title: Strictly's Michelle Visage admits her 'jaw dropped to the floor' when Catherine Tyldesley was axed
text:
Strictly Come Dancing star Michelle Visage's 'jaw dropped' when Catherine Tyldesley was axed from the show on Sunday and Mike Bushell got through to next week.

Appearing on Monday's Lorraine, Michelle said: 'My jaw was on the ground… It just shows you, you have to vote for your favourite people. We rely on that.'

She went on: 'Cath and Johannes [Radebe] are two of my closest friends in this competition. So sad to see them go, and I love them so much.

Shock! Strictly Come Dancing star Michelle Visage's 'jaw dropped' when Catherine Tyldesley was axed from the show on Sunday and Mike Bushell got through to next week

'Cath is a sweetheart and she is just on top of the world that she made it to Halloween week.'

Speaking about her amazing score following her Addams’ family-inspired dance at the weekend, she said: 'It was a foxtrot… he [Giovanni Pernice] is basically driving me like a car, because you see how far back my posture is and my neck… you can’t see where you are going. So much trust is involved.'

Michelle added: 'It was an amazing high. It was "Oh my goodness our first ten of the series". The highest score of the series… but you can’t relish it for too long as you are then on to a new dance.'

She added she would be straight off to dance rehearsals following her Lorraine appearance, saying: 'You think we have a week, we really have three and a half days when all is said and done… there is pressure every time.

Michelle said: 'Cath and Johannes [Radebe] are two of my closest friends in this competition. So sad to see them go, and I love them so much'

Appearing on Monday's Lorraine, Michelle said: 'My jaw was on the ground… It just shows you, you have to vote for your favourite people. We rely on that'

'I don’t want to let my partner down, who is a champ, he’s incredible and he’s so good at what he does. But, at the same time I want to learn, I want to be a dancer by the end of this.

'I don’t ever want to stop, I’m having the best time of my life. I never thought I would love doing ballroom dancing. And look at it!'

She also told Lorraine how having her breast implants removed and taking to the dance floor has given her a new lease of life.

'I am having the time of my life. Coming into this competition representing the women of a certain age, being 51. I don’t want to keep harping on that but I knew I was going to be asking my body to do things it has never done before… being out there and doing what I’m asking it to do for eight hours a day.

She went on: 'Cath and Johannes [Radebe] are two of my closest friends in this competition. So sad to see them go, and I love them so much'

Candid: She also told Lorraine how having her breast implants removed and taking to the dance floor has given her a new lease of life

'I’m most proud of my body listening to me. Giovanni is the best partner for me, the best teacher for me, is my rock through all of this and I rely on him.'

Asked if it was a ‘rebirth of sorts’, she agreed: '100 percent for me because I had so many health issues for the last 20 year on and off struggling with auto-immune issues. It was a long litany of things that were going on.

'So when I took control of my health by removing my breast implants and I started to feel better I thought what better way to have a second chance of life than Strictly.'

She added being ill over the years had not been easy, explaining: 'I am the sole bread-winner for a family of four. My husband is a stay at home dad. We don’t eat, we don’t pay the bills, the rent unless, I work.'

Asked if it was a ‘rebirth of sorts’, she agreed: '100 percent for me because I had so many health issues for the last 20 year on and off struggling with auto-immune issues. It was a long litany of things that were going on'

She added being ill over the years had not been easy, explaining: 'I am the sole bread-winner for a family of four. My husband is a stay at home dad. We don’t eat, we don’t pay the bills, the rent unless, I work'

She said: 'I don’t ever want to stop, I’m having the best time of my life. I never thought I would love doing ballroom dancing. And look at it'

On whether she felt immediately better once her breast implants were taken out, she continued: 'I actually had a really bad recovery. It was very, very difficult. I went in [to hospital] impaired. The brain fog… I felt like I wasn’t in my own body. It was so bizarre. Heart rate issues, all sort of things were going on because of them. Not knowing that this was the cause of it.

'So, when I took it out it took a good six weeks to get me on my feet. To the point where I thought, ‘How am I going to be able to dance? I can’t even go to the ladies’ room by myself.’ My husband had to walk me to the ladies’ room, it was crazy.

'It started to get better and better and better and now I’m able to detoxify. Each time I sweat or I’m pushing through an eight hour rehearsal I think, "I’m healing, I’m healing, I’m healing". That’s what pushes it through. I think, "Oh my goodness this is a new woman, a chance at life again".'
description: Strictly Come Dancing star Michelle Visage's 'jaw dropped' when Catherine Tyldesley was axed from the show on Sunday and Mike Bushell got through to next week.
